intro: Centropogon rubrosepalus, commonly known as the red-sepal centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red sepals and showy flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
